posts.name:
Angel Ngele
Angel Ngele
posts.content:
Here are 7 public speaking "myths" you should stop believing.

These come up all the time with my clients → let's bust them today!

1. You need to be born a great speaker
Truth: Speaking is a skill you can learn, just like riding a bike.

2. Only extroverts are good speakers
Truth: Many introverts are AMAZING speakers because they prepare so well.

3. You can’t make mistakes
Truth: Mistakes make you human. Audiences care more about your message than perfection.

4. You have to memorize everything
Truth: Knowing your key points is enough, don’t aim for a word-for-word script.

5. You have to use big, fancy words
Truth: Simple language connects better with everyone.

6. I don't need public speaking
Truth: Everyone uses public speaking to speak to friends, colleagues, and even families. Public speaking is communicating with at least 1 person daily.

7. Great speakers never feel scared
Truth: Even pros get nervous, they just know how to channel it into excitement.

7 truths to speak with confidence:

1. Practice out loud, not just in your head.
2. Start small, and speak in front of friends or colleagues.
3. Focus on helping your audience, not on being perfect.
4. Use pauses to think, it’s powerful, not awkward.
5. Smile and make eye contact, it builds trust.
6. Use stories, they’re memorable and engaging.
7. Remember, every great speaker starts as a beginner.

Bonus: Be kind to yourself. Growth takes time, but it’s worth it. ️

Speaking is for everyone. Now’s your time to shine.

(Feel free to share this if it helps you!) ️

comments.commentText: This is a fantastic breakdown! Public speaking is so often misunderstood, and these myths hold many people back.
Muhammad Usman What others have you heard?

Focus on helping your audience not just on being perfect!

This is a great reminder. Angel Ngele
Muhammad Sufyan True, I love how you put it. Wise words from a wise expert.

posts.name:
Manuj Aggarwal
Manuj Aggarwal
posts.content:
TSMC posts 57% profit surge - while you are still on the AI sidelines.

First of all, what is this TSMC.

It is the Taiwanese company behind every chip that powers AI.

It is a Taiwanese company because of which China wants Taiwan so bad.

TSMC has shocked the world with a 57% profit surge,

all thanks to the AI boom.

I urge you to look at these numbers and wake up.

If you have these questions in your mind:

Will AI replace me?
Will my business become obsolete?
How do I keep up when I can barely understand the latest tech trends?

Then I am here to answer them

I know what it feels like to be an outsider.

I have had the odds were stacked against me

no resources, no roadmap, no room for error.

But I discovered something game-changing: innovation doesn’t wait.

You don’t have to be the smartest or most resourced person in the room

you just have to act.

Fast forward to today, I’m leading an AI consulting company, TetraNoodle, that has:

- Helped startups grow into IPOs in as little as 2 years.
- Delivered over $500M in business value to global clients.
- Worked with Fortune 500 leaders to multiply their results using AI.

But what I’ve learned is this: most leaders don’t fail because of a lack of

they fail because of fear and inaction.

Now, here’s the truth no one else will tell you:

AI isn’t here to replace you; it’s here to elevate you.

But only if you know how to harness it.

That’s why I created AI Merge,

an exclusive program for business leaders who want to:

- Increase their intrinsic value and achieve exponential growth,
- Create freedom, clarity, and peace of mind while scaling to the next level.
- Make better decisions faster with cutting-edge strategies.
- Save hundreds of hours by automating tedious tasks.

You’ll gain direct access to me, my proven frameworks, and a curated group of visionary leaders who are ready to ride this wave

not get wiped out by it.

The clock is ticking.

AI is already reshaping industries.

The winners will be those who move now, not later.

So ask yourself:

 Will you lead this revolution - or watch from the sidelines?
 Will you embrace the future - or let fear hold you back?

This isn’t a "someday" opportunity.

It’s a right-now decision.

Interested to learn more about AI Merge?

Drop a comment or DM me.

posts.name:
Grandhi Praveen
Grandhi Praveen
posts.content:
Celebrating National Startup Day at T-Hub 

Honored to be a part of National Startup Day at T-Hub, Hyderabad, a hub of innovation and entrepreneurship! This event was a fantastic opportunity to connect with like-minded entrepreneurs, investors, and thought leaders who are shaping the future of India's startup ecosystem.

From insightful panel discussions to inspiring startup pitches, the energy and passion for innovation were truly infectious! Events like these remind us of the incredible potential of the Startup India movement and the role of technology, creativity, and perseverance in building the next big success stories.
A big shoutout tofor organizing such a vibrant and impactful event. Excited for what the future holds for startups in India!

posts.name:
nick stagge 💭
nick stagge 💭
posts.content:
Reason 492 I don't like WFH. 

Yesterday we had Bre Marrder & Obed Marrder in the office for a 2025 planning session. Some highlights included:

- In depth discussions at the Vibe board about current performance.
- Arguably the worst stick figure drawing of a baby of all time.
- A deep dive into the product roadmap & potential bundles.
- Lot's of laughs and good vibes.
- Exploring channel priorities & key activation points.
- A debate about messaging, claims, and the 'why people buy'.
- Delicious greek from Padeli's (IYKYK).

We are lucky enough to meet a lot of entrepreneurs and help them achieve their dreams. But honestly, it's not everyday you get to work with people as passionate, dedicated, collaborative, and fun as the Marrders.

Not to mention, their product isn't something people just say is "innovative". It truly is changing the game - and if I were a gambling man... it will be one of the next huge brands to come from Utah.


Oh - and a humble brag:
I think it's clear to say baby Matthew likes me the most. We had a heck of a time walking around the table throwing plastic spoons around. Tell me he's not the cutest.

comments.commentText: In person vibes are always better!  and as always thank you for the kind words  we sure have a lot of fun with you and your team(s)
